sentences.sContent: Learning goes on throughout life.
You have your whole life ahead of you.
sentences.sCn: 你前面还有漫长的人生呢。

sentences.sContent: I’ve known John all my life (= since I was born ).
His main aim in life was to have fun.
sentences.sCn: 他人生的主要目标就是享乐。

sentences.sContent: It was one of the best days of my life.
sentences.sCn: 那是我一生中最快乐的时光之一。

sentences.sContent: The accident scarred him for life (= for the rest of his life ).
sentences.sCn: 这场事故给他留下了终生的创伤。

sentences.sContent: She knew she’d feel guilty for the rest of her life.
sentences.sCn: 她知道自己将内疚终生。

sentences.sContent: Raj spent his life caring for others.
sentences.sCn: 拉杰一辈子都在关爱他人。

sentences.sContent: Bonington spent his entire adult life in France.
sentences.sCn: 博宁顿成年后就一直在法国生活。

sentences.sContent: We don’t know much about the poet’s early life (= when he was young ).
sentences.sCn: 我们对这位诗人的早年生活所知甚少。

sentences.sContent: Poor diet can lead to a whole range of diseases in later life (= when you are older ).
sentences.sCn: 饮食不良会在晚年引发各种疾病。

sentences.sContent: She married late in life (= when she was fairly old ).
He’s a life member (= continuing until he dies ) of the club.
sentences.sCn: 他是俱乐部的终身会员。
